cyclone.name: DELTA
cyclone.current_location: about 425 miles south of Cameron, Louisiana
cyclone.trajectory: Moving northwest across the central Gulf, forecast to turn north tonight and north-northeast on Friday toward the southwest-central Louisiana coast.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near Cameron, Louisiana (west of Morgan City)

weather_observation.watch_coast: East of the mouth of the Pearl River to Bay St. Louis, MS (T.S. Watch in effect)
weather_observation.warning_coast: San Luis Pass, TX to Sabine Pass and east of Morgan City, LA to the mouth of the Pearl River, including New Orleans, Lake Pontchartrain and Lake Maurepas (T.S. Warning); Storm-surge warning Sabine Pass, TX to Ocean Springs, MS including the Lakes
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire Louisiana coastline, especially from Sabine Pass through Morgan City and the Mississippi River Delta, with effects extending into western Mississippi coast.
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (39-57 mph) expected Friday, low (5%) chance of sustained 50-kt winds, gusts higher.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 2–4 ft possible along Lake Borgne, Lake Pontchartrain, Lake Maurepas and the Mississippi River Delta.
weather_observation.rainfall: 3–6 inches with locally higher totals could cause flash and urban flooding in the New Orleans area Friday–Saturday.
weather_observation.other_hazards: A few tornadoes possible Friday; dangerous surf, rip currents and elevated river levels may disrupt marine and port operations.
